comms: The possessor NP displays some properties of a clause-level dependent.
comms_internal: РР: «Между словами Басирды и кьул можно поставить слова с разными значениями: например, писана (сильно), гьими арий (сейчас). Порядок слов в предложении можно изменить: например, Кьул ветив Басирды (голова болит у Басира), Ветив кьул Басирды (болит голова у Басира), это зависит от логического ударения в предложении.»

comms: Not included in the database because this translation is semantically inaccurate.

comms_internal: The original sentence was “Басир аьхъаьчlур хал”, but I changed it because ‘house’ has some unusual properties. “Basir entered the school” is “basir aˁč’uˁr mixteb”. The bear entered the school is “Си аьвчlур михьтеб”. The X-argument is in the nominative case even though the Y-argument is in the nominative case, too.

comms_internal: The use of the ATTR form on the predicate is probably triggered by the information structure ('It is one year since…').
CV. Alternative is the construction with “kilaʁu-n” that features the TR pattern, cf. “basir kilaʁva-r a karam” [PN(ERG) (M).IPF.mock-SIMUL EXIST PN].
Same as 18, 75. This pattern coexists with the more specialized CV “sɨs kiʔɨ-n” with the ERG_CONT pattern: “tɨlɨj-re sɨs kiʔɨ-r basir-ɨkj” [dog.OBL-ERG bite (N)pour.PF-AOR PN-CONT

comms_internal: An alternative is also semantically inaccurate: “basir mezij-xvan raˁʁaˁ-r a bik'er-dɨ čej” [PN pleasure.OBL-COM (N)drink.IPF-SIMUL EXIST hot-ATTR tea] ‘Basir is drinking tea with pleasure’.
The root is defective, IPF only, so the MSD, being PF has to go periphrastic.
